column2: These laws effect treatment and tolerance between different cultures in the realm.
Cultural differences are not important between members of the court, and provinces will not adopt your culture
Provinces are encouraged to adopt your culture.
These laws effect treatment and tolerance between different religions in the realm.
Religious differences are not important between members of the court, and provinces will not be converted by a chaplain. Holy wars are prohibited.
Religious difference are less important, and conversions by a Chaplain are slower. Holy wars vassalize those of different religions rather than revoking.
Harsher attitudes towards those of different religions, and increased fervor in conversion.

This slider indicates the relative organization of a Muslim realm, which will dynamically adjust after meeting certain event-driven criteria.
As leader of a fast-moving and decentralized realm you are considered the judge and jury as your realm seeks to outwardly expand.
As the realm begins to grow larger you delegate your judicial authority to a trusted body of generals who oversee the just rule of your realm.

The Factions of the Court and the Factions representing the military have gain a considerable amount of authority in your realm. Your realm as at a crossroads as factions push on either sides the future they see of the realm.

As the realm stablizies your court has demanded more say in the jurisprudence and good guidance of the realm, forming the bases of courtly offices which oversee the many internal functions of the realm at the expense of external expansion.

The bureaucracy to maintain the realm has grown so large that you have become dominated by the myriad of advisors, viziers, and delegation representing the many peoples in your realm that outward expansion has been severely hampered by bureaucratic indecisiveness.
